args.name: ID
args.description: id of the post

args.name: slug
args.description: name of the post

args.name: post_type
args.description: type of the post

fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of an object

types.name: WPQuery
types.description: deals with the intricacies of a post request on a WordPress blog

args.name: posts_per_page
args.description: number of post to show per page

args.name: paged
args.description: number of page.

args.name: post_type
args.description: Retrieves posts by Post Types, default value is 'post'.

args.name: post_status
args.description: Default value is 'publish', but if the user is logged in, 'private' is added

args.name: name
args.description: Retrieves post by name

args.name: order
args.description: Designates the ascending or descending order of the 'orderby' parameter. Defaults to 'DESC'. An array can be used for multiple order/orderby sets.

args.name: orderby
args.description: Sort retrieved posts by parameter. Defaults to 'date (post_date)'. One or more options can be passed.

args.name: s
args.description: Show posts based on a keyword search.

args.name: cat
args.description: Show in this category id

args.name: category_name
args.description: Show in this category slug

args.name: tag
args.description: Show in this tag slug

args.name: tag_id
args.description: Show in this tag id

args.name: name
args.description: Menu 'id','name' or 'slug'

fields.name: terms
fields.description: Retrieve the terms in a given taxonomy or list of taxonomies.

args.name: taxonomies
args.description: Array of Taxonomy names. Overides taxonomy argument

args.name: taxonomy
args.description: The taxonomy for which to retrieve terms. Defaults to category

args.name: orderby
args.description: Field(s) to order terms by. Accepts term fields ('name', 'slug', 'term_group', 'term_id', 'id', 'description'), 'count' for term taxonomy count, 'include' to match the 'order' of the include param, or 'none' to skip ORDER BY. Defaults to 'name'

args.name: order
args.description: Whether to order terms in ascending or descending order. Accepts 'ASC' (ascending) or 'DESC' (descending). Default 'ASC

args.name: hide_empty
args.description: Whether to order terms in ascending or descending order. Accepts 'ASC' (ascending) or 'DESC' (descending). Default 'ASC'

args.name: include
args.description: Array of term ids to include. Default empty array

args.name: exclude
args.description: Array of term ids to exclude. Default empty array

args.name: exclude_tree
args.description: Term ids to exclude along with all of their descendant terms. If include is non-empty, exclude_tree is ignored

args.name: number
args.description: Maximum number of terms to return. Default 0 (all)

args.name: offset
args.description: The number by which to offset the terms query.

args.name: name
args.description: Array of names to return terms for

args.name: slug
args.description: Array of slugs to return terms for

args.name: hierarchical
args.description: Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if hide_empty is set to true). Default true

args.name: search
args.description: Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after.

args.name: name__like
args.description: Retrieve terms with criteria by which a term is LIKE name__like

args.name: description__like
args.description: Retrieve terms where the description is LIKE description__like

args.name: pad_counts
args.description: Whether to pad the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable. Default false

args.name: get
args.description: Whether to return terms regardless of ancestry or whether the terms are empty. Accepts 'all' or empty (disabled).

args.name: child_of
args.description: Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, child_of is ignored. Default 0

args.name: parent
args.description: Parent term ID to retrieve direct-child terms of.

args.name: childless
args.description: True to limit results to terms that have no children. This parameter has no effect on non-hierarchical taxonomies. Default false.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The full content of the post

args.description: Defaults to ASC

types.name: ImageSrc
types.description:
A mime icon for files, thumbnail or intermediate size for images.
        see https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/wp_get_attachment_image_src

types.name: WPTerm
types.description: Base class for taxonomies such as Category & Tag

types.name: Category
types.description: The \'category\' taxonomy lets you group posts together by sorting them into various categories.

types.name: Tag
types.description: The \'post_tag\' taxonomy is similar to categories, but more free form.

types.name: PostFormat
types.description: The 'post_format' taxonomy was introduced in WordPress 3.1 and it is a piece of meta information that can be used by a theme to customize its presentation of a post

types.name: Product
types.description: The WooCommerce product class handles individual product data.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query and mutation operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true
